result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Ray Love was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office. Bond to be applied and balance to be applied to DNA sample surcharge.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office. Remainder of bond to be applied. Failure to pay remainder of DNA sample surcharge will be warrant.
May not possess or use firearms.
Cannot vote until civil rights are restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation.
Must complete an AODA assessment and follow recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Must appear at jail today (8/20/2015). Must sit 60 days up front and the remainder is banked for use by Probation if necessary.
Must complete 25 hours of community service per year while on probation for a total of 75 hours.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Ray Love
